posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Paragon is a subrace of what race? DD requires Dwarf. RDD requires an arcane casting base class, and Monk doesn't qualify.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Empyre65 wrote: Paragon is a subrace of what race? DD requires Dwarf. RDD requires an arcane casting base class, and Monk doesn't qualify.
Ah, this all reflects the changes made to the PW (the Awakening). I only had a brief look at the link, but some of those changes (apart from it being capped at level 60) include no arcane caster class required for RDD, and this Paragon is not a sub-race, rather an exemplar of his/her type (a bit like when people were working on Yardstick builds here). Of course, if you want a prestige class to be your paragon, you'll need to take the requisite feats/levels/etc before you can qualify for it. So, with non-prestige it's single class, but with prestige it's dual class.

Interesting, but not exactly traditional!
